intro: Buglossoides arvensis subsp. permixta, commonly known as the common bugloss, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and has a creeping growth habit with a short, upright stem. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, aiding in its spread. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
